title: Arts and Culture Festival seeks to preserve culture in Uganda
content:
KAMPALA, Nov. 7 (Xinhua) -- From traditional fabric clothes and painting to unique musical instrument and dance, a three-day Art and Culture Festival has been held in Uganda to popularize and preserve Ugandan culture.
Models showcase African traditional fabric clothes during the 2019 Uganda National Cultural Centre annual art and culture festival in Kampala, capital of Uganda, Nov. 3, 2019. (Xinhua/Nicholas Kajoba)
Visitors paint at the Art exhibition center during the 2019 Uganda National Cultural Centre annual art and culture festival in Kampala, capital of Uganda, Nov. 3, 2019. (Xinhua/Nicholas Kajoba)
Dancers perform during the closing ceremony of the 2019 Uganda National Cultural Centre annual art and culture festival in Kampala, capital of Uganda, Nov. 3, 2019. (Xinhua/Nicholas Kajoba)
Dancers perform during the closing ceremony of the 2019 Uganda National Cultural Centre annual art and culture festival in Kampala, capital of Uganda, Nov. 3, 2019. (Xinhua/Nicholas Kajoba)â
